trot.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: if a horse trots, it moves fairly quickly with each front leg moving at the same time as the opposite back leg
trot.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if a person or animal trots, they run fairly slowly, taking short regular steps
trot.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She came trotting down the steps from the library.
trot.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to walk or go somewhere, especially fairly quickly
trot.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: He trotted off and came back a couple of minutes later, holding a parcel.
trot.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the movement of a horse at trotting speed
trot.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Our horses slowed to a trot.
trot.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a ride on a horse at trotting speed
trot.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a fairly slow way of running in which you take short regular steps
trot.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: She broke into a trot  (=started running slowly) and hurried on ahead of us.
trot.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a book of notes or answers used by students, especially to cheat in tests
trot.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: an insulting word for a Trotskyite
